entry.question: What is the 'Battlefield'?
entry.answer: The game area in which the characters in play are placed.

entry.question: What is the 'Deck'?
entry.answer: Your battle cards are shuffled and placed face down. You draw cards from your deck. As soon as the deck runs out of cards you reshuffle the scrap and that becomes your new deck.

entry.question: What does it mean to 'Flip (battle card)'?
entry.answer: The act of taking a battle card from the deck and placing it face up onto the Battlefield.

entry.question: What is 'Flip (character card)'?
entry.answer: Changing a character (i.e. Transformer) card from one mode to another by switching its card to the other side.

entry.question: What is 'KO Area'?
entry.answer: Most KO'd characters are moved to the KO area (see Battle Master and Weaponizer for notable exceptons). The KO area is usually off to the side of the main battlefield, out of the way of the play but still visible. Note that characters may still be flipped as a part of your flip action, however they cannot be flipped by battle cards unless a card specifically states it can.

entry.question: What is 'KO (Knock Out)'?
entry.answer: When a character's damage equals or exceeds its health (including any additional health bonuses), the character is said to be KO'd.

entry.question: Do upgrades stay on KO'd characters?
entry.answer: When a character is knocked out, their upgrades go to the scrap pile, unless a card ability says otherwise.

entry.question: What is a 'Battle Icon'?
entry.answer: An oblong of colour in the right hand corner of a battle card.

entry.question: What is the 'Scrap'?
entry.answer: Used battle cards are placed face-up in the scrap pile. Either player may examine either scrap pile at any time. As soon as the deck runs out of cards, the scrap pile is shuffled to form the new deck.

entry.question: What is a 'Battle Card'?
entry.answer: Your deck has two types of card in it, cards which are placed on the table at the start of the game and cards that are placed in a face-down stack. The Battle Cards are the cards that are placed in the face-down stack. To date they will say either Action or Upgrade on them on the middle left of the deck, and they are all the same size. They all have the same grey/white/red background image.

entry.question: What is a 'Character Card'?
entry.answer: Your deck has two types of card in it, cards which are placed on the table at the start of the game and cards that are placed in a face-down stack. The Character Cards represent particular Transformers and are placed on the table. They have a star cost (in the bottom left hand corner of one side of the card). In the middle of the card a 'mode' will be indicated.

entry.question: What is a 'Stratagem Card'?
entry.answer: Your deck has two types of card in it, cards which are placed on the table at the start of the game and cards that are placed in a face-down stack. The Stratagem Cards represent a background theme and are placed on the table. They have a star cost (in the bottom left hand corner of one side of the card). In the middle of the card they state that they are a 'STRATAGEM'.

entry.question: What is a 'Faction'?
entry.answer: Characters belong to a Faction. Currently each Transformer can only belong to one Faction, though there are characters in the Transformer storylines who were double-agents and so that may change. There are currently (Wave 5) three factions in the game, Autobots, Decepticons and Mercenaries.

entry.question: Who are the Mercenaries?
entry.answer: The Mercenary Faction is a new faction added to the Transformer storyline in 2019, across the comics, toys, cartoons, and the Trading Card Game, which was the first to announce the new faction.

entry.question: What is the 'Scrap'?
entry.answer: Battle cards you have used, either by playing or flipping, are discarded at the end of your turn. The discard pile is called the scrap.

entry.question: What is a 'blue battle icon'?
entry.answer: A blue oblong in the right hand corner of a battle card. "The defender gets +1 defense for each blue battle icon you flip when attacking."

entry.question: What is an 'orange battle icon'?
entry.answer: An orange oblong in the right hand corner of a battle card. "The attacker gets +1 attack for each orange battle icon you flip when attacking."

entry.question: What is a 'white battle icon'?
entry.answer: An white oblong in the right hand corner of a battle card. When attacking or defending, the first white battle icon flipped means the player flips two more battle cards. Additional white icons do not lead to more battle cards being flipped unless an effect explicitly states it does.

entry.question: What is 'Bold [x]'?
entry.answer: "Flip [x] more battle cards when attacking. "

entry.question: What is 'Tough [x]'?
entry.answer: Flip [x] more battle cards when defending.

entry.question: Does Focus stack?
entry.answer: Yes, Focus stacks. Per the 2.0 Rules; Focus is a single action, so if a character has multiple instances of focus, add the numbers together to determine how many cards to look at. For example, if a character has Focus 1 and is upgraded with a utility that gives it another instance of Focus 1, look at the top two cards of your deck before flipping battle cards. You may scrap any number of them and put the rest back on top of your deck in any order.

entry.question: What is a 'Trait'?
entry.answer: Traits appear on Character Cards as icons under the character names. For example, Ranged, Car, and Titan Master.
